name: Apple
usageTips: Use in savory dishes like pork chops
description: A sweet, edible fruit produced by an apple tree. Apples are rich in antioxidants, flavonoids, and dietary fiber. They come in various colors including red, green, and yellow, and are known for their juicy and crisp texture.
history: Cultivated for thousands of years in Asia and Europe, apples were brought to North America by European colonists.
storageTips: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight.
To prevent browning, soak cut apples in water mixed with a bit of lemon juice.
healthBenefits: May reduce the risk of heart disease
Linked to a lower risk of diabetes
pesticides: Conventionally grown apples may have pesticide residues; washing or peeling is recommended.
culturalSignificance: Symbol of health and prosperity in many cultures, often associated with knowledge and education, featured in numerous myths and folklore.
